name: Parsnip Ecrasse
description: This easy mashed side dish from Daniel Humm, the chef of Eleven Madison Park and NoMad in New York, substitutes the delicately sweet parsnip for the traditional potato. "I think sometimes with the parsnip, people are maybe a little afraid and don't use it as often,'' Mr. Humm says. "That’s why we wanted to include this recipe and show how simple it is. And it's really flavorful.''
keywords: fall, gluten-free, kosher, nut-free, vegetarian, parsnip, side dish

recipeInstructions.text: Peel the parsnips and dice into uniform cubes.
Cook parsnips in salted boiling water until tender.
Drain the water from the parsnips and mash with a fork. Add butter and warmed half-and-half. Finish with chopped parsley and season to taste with salt and pepper.
